metadata.Title: CVE-2015-5311 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
PowerDNS (aka pdns) Authoritative Server 3.4.4 before 3.4.7 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure and server crash) via crafted query packets.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-5311` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

pdns-backend-bind - 3.4.7-1
pdns-backend-geoip - 3.4.7-1
pdns-backend-ldap - 3.4.7-1
pdns-backend-lua - 3.4.7-1
pdns-backend-mydns - 3.4.7-1
pdns-backend-mysql - 3.4.7-1
pdns-backend-odbc - 3.4.7-1
pdns-backend-opendbx - 3.4.7-1
pdns-backend-pgsql - 3.4.7-1
pdns-backend-pipe - 3.4.7-1
pdns-backend-remote - 3.4.7-1
pdns-backend-sqlite3 - 3.4.7-1
pdns-backend-tinydns - 3.4.7-1
pdns-server - 3.4.7-1
pdns-tools - 3.4.7-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pdns package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.4.7-1').
